item.title: GraphRAG for Global Development - Concept Note
item.description: This concept note introduces a GraphRAG approach to extracting knowledge from global development documentation and invites partners to contribute.

item.title: How to integrate generative AI in Obsidian
item.description: A review of common approaches to leveraging the power of generative AI in personal knowledge management systems.

item.title: Vibe coding my data science portfolio
item.description: How I “vibe coded” a web portfolio to showcase my data science projects.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi ðŸ‘‹, I’m Erik. I’m on a mission to help aspiring data scientists in the fields of conservation, social impact and global development.

education

I studied environmental science with a focus on economics at Colorado State University. I was interested in how economic incentives could catalyze better stewardship of the environment.

While at CSU I wrote a weekly column for the student newspaper, the Collegian. You can read more on my previous blog the 651st word. I was also a fellow with the Center for Collaborative Conservation and had the chance to work on their Colorado Conservation Exchange which (some years later) I helped launch as the Peaks to People Water Fund.

item.title: Classifying transactions with deep learning for financial models
item.description: An AI-powered classifier for financial transactions

item.title: Translating image styles with CycleGAN from Monet to photos
item.description: Using the CycleGAN generative adversarial network to stylize photos in the style of Monet.

item.title: Using NLP with Twitter to monitor natural disasters
item.description: When disaster strikes, real-time social media monitoring can be a powerful tool for early warning and response. This project analyzes Twitter data to identify posts that describe actual natural disasters, which could potentially serve as an early warning system for governmental and humanitarian organizations.

item.title: News topic modeling with matrix factorization
item.description: A comparative analysis of unsupervised and supervised machine learning techniques for classifying news articles into predefined categories

item.description: A case study on the importance of a hacker mindset for new coders

item.title: How to set up your laptop for data science in 2025 (Windows edition)
item.description: Install Python with miniforge3 and mamba

item.title: An unsupervised learning approach to cat vocalizations
item.description: An analysis of cat vocalizations using machine learning techniques to identify patterns in cat meows across different contexts. The project uses the Cat Meow Classification dataset from Kaggle, which contains 440 audio recordings of cat meows in three specific contexts: brushing, waiting for food, and isolation in an unfamiliar environment.

item.title: Foraging for mushrooms in random forests
item.description: Using supervised machine learning techniques to classify mushrooms as either poisonous or edible, emphasizing the importance of model evaluation metrics.

item.description: Have you heard of the MEL tax? This post explains the tension between MEL teams and Program Officers at non-profits and foundations.
